world_news:
• Hamas has responded to the US-backed Gaza ceasefire proposal, seeking amendments that include a guaranteed permanent end to the war and a full Israeli withdrawal, while the US reviews the counteroffer.
  • G7 leaders are reportedly close to an agreement to use profits from frozen Russian assets to provide a $50 billion loan to Ukraine to aid its war effort and economy.
  • Political uncertainty intensifies in France as a new left-wing alliance forms to challenge both President Macron's centrist party and Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally in upcoming snap parliamentary elections.
us_news:
• Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, has been found guilty on all three felony charges in his federal gun trial, marking the first time the child of a sitting president has been criminally convicted.
  • The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady and signaled that it now expects to make only one rate cut in 2024, down from a previous projection of three, citing still-elevated inflation.
  • A powerful heat dome is causing record-breaking temperatures across the Southwestern US, placing millions under excessive heat warnings and straining public health resources and power grids.
tech_news:
• Apple's new 'Apple Intelligence' AI platform, which includes a partnership with OpenAI for ChatGPT integration, dominated tech news, though it also drew criticism from Elon Musk over privacy concerns.
  • Oracle shares soared over 13% after the company announced major cloud deals with Google and OpenAI, signaling strong momentum in the race to provide infrastructure for AI models.
  • Chipmaker Broadcom saw its stock jump after reporting strong earnings driven by AI-related demand and announcing a 10-for-1 stock split, fueling more investor excitement in the AI sector.
financial_news:
• The May Consumer Price Index (CPI) report showed inflation cooled more than expected, with prices flat for the month, giving markets a boost on hopes of earlier interest rate cuts.
  • The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite closed at new all-time highs, with the S&P 500 topping 5,400 for the first time, fueled by the encouraging inflation data and a continued rally in tech stocks.
  • Following its latest meeting, the Federal Reserve kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged but released new projections indicating officials foresee only a single quarter-point rate cut this year.
conspiracies:
• The 'Project 2025' plan, a conservative policy agenda for a potential new Trump administration, is being framed online as a secretive plot to establish a Christian nationalist autocracy and dismantle democratic institutions.
  • The theory that the H5N1 bird flu outbreak is a 'plandemic' is spreading, with claims that global elites are manufacturing the crisis to enforce new lockdowns, mandate vaccines, and seize control of the food supply.
  • Following recent wildfires, the conspiracy theory that Directed Energy Weapons (DEWs) are being used by a shadowy government entity to intentionally start fires for nefarious purposes, such as land grabs or to push a climate change agenda, has resurfaced on social media.
